messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] private email addresses
messages.msgSnippet: ... Hey! My computer geek dh just helped me figure out why I couldn t see people s email addresses. For some reason this is the only list I m on that sends
messages.messageBody:
> But I'm not getting people's email addresses displayed next to their names

Hey! My computer geek dh just helped me figure out why I couldn't "see" people's email
addresses. For some reason this is the only list I'm on that sends out messages in RTF
format (my husband says that using RTF is not very good because it makes the messages bigger
than they need to be). Well, when I changed my options on Outlook Express to that I would
reply in Plain Text as opposed to the same format that the message was sent in - Voila! I
can now see people's email addresses!

Diana Tashjian

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] private email addresses
messages.msgSnippet: In Outlook Express go to File, Properties and then Details or Message Source.  Scroll through all the gobbly de goop until you come to a From line. Lynda ...
messages.messageBody:
In Outlook Express go to File, Properties and then Details or Message
Source. Scroll through all the gobbly de goop until you come to a From
line.

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: "Diana Tashjian" <diana@...>

> You know, this is exactly what I do for other lists that I'm on - I don't
know why it doesn't work with this list - and I, too, use Outlook Express.
It's a mystery to me...
>
> Diana Tashjian

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] private email addresses
messages.msgSnippet: You know, this is exactly what I do for other lists that I m on - I don t know why it doesn t work with this list - and I, too, use Outlook Express. It s a
messages.messageBody:
You know, this is exactly what I do for other lists that I'm on - I don't know why it doesn't work with this list - and I, too, use Outlook Express. It's a mystery to me...

Diana Tashjian
----- Original Message -----
From: Dennis/Laurie Brown
<snip>

Try pretending you are going to send a reply or forward the message. On
mine when I bring up a reply to or forward message screen, the addresses of
the post I'm responding to is listed beside the name. Just don't send the
'reply' if you don't want it to go to the list!

Highlight the address, copy and paste into a new message form. Should work.

I use Outlook Express, if that helps any. AOL or something else may show up
differently.

Hope it helps,
Eiraul


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

mine when I bring up a reply to or forward message screen, the addresses of

'reply' if you don't want it to go to the list!

Highlight the address, copy and paste into a new message form. Should work.

Eiraul

Thanks for any help!
Diana Tashjian
